name: Kepler-317
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-317 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-317 is a star with 0.857 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.94 times its radius. It is located 3150.18 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-317 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-317 b

Kepler-317 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.52 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-317.

The mass of Kepler-317 b is 5.61 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-317 b is 2.09 that of Earth. At 5.61 Earth masses, Kepler-317 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-317 c

Kepler-317 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.78 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-317.

The mass of Kepler-317 c is 3.51 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-317 c is 1.72 that of Earth. At 3.51 Earth masses, Kepler-317 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-317, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
